website_summaries.verdict: Customers seeking a minimal belt with ultra-slim construction will appreciate this lightweight model.
pros: Comes in a variety of color options and styles
Large enough to hold most smartphones
Stays firmly in place with no-bounce construction
cons: Many plus-size customers had issues fitting into the adjustable belt

customer_reviews.title: Beware of fake products
customer_reviews.text: This was a fake, not an actual Spibelt. The multi colored belt in my pic is the one I already had for a year. I use it everyday and wanted to order a new one in black with purple zipper. The fake one actually has 2 pouches, less stretchy fabric and larger buckles. I will be returning it and may need to order directly from company to make sure to get actual product that I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle1981

customer_reviews.title: Apple iPhone 11 - tight fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go hiking in Sedona thinking it would be a convenient way to have my phone along for taking pictures and it would be out of my way and snug to my body for bouldering. With all that being true, it was not easy to get my phone in and out easily for picture taking. Anyone who has been to Sedona, there are a lot of picture taking opportunities. :) This is will be great for running to have my phone along but not needing to access it often. Room enough for my phone and key fob but that is about it. Nice quality and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: frugal Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I returned it for a few reasons. The zipper seemed flimsy and tended to stick. The belt does not comfortably fit the larger waist sizes advertised, but must stretch significantly to do so, which felt uncomfortable. And while I realize that ultra-compactness may be a desirable feature to many, I could not fit anything more than a small phone in the pouch, certainly not a wallet as well. However admittedly I am probably not part of the target demographic. And on the plus side, a big, big plus, it is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: jas mann

customer_reviews.title: No bouncing (with minimal loads)
customer_reviews.text: Used it to hold an iPhone SE and after 5k I had forgotten it was there. No bouncing. Love it. Coming back after running a few hundred miles with this to edit the review. It does in fact bounce if you overload it. There is a fine line between no bounce weight and bounce City. Going on a quick 5K? This is a great way to stash phone and keys. Going on a 20miler? Shove in your phone, keys and a few gels and get ready to battle the belt as it alternates between shooting for the stars and reaching for the earth’s core.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: This belt is so useful. I love that it actually zips instead of ...
customer_reviews.text: This belt is so useful. I love that it actually zips instead of being a flap, and that it stretches just a ridiculous amount. I originally bought a red one, while I was in Tokyo, and they had displays where you could stretch them out and see how much they would hold. That's what made me love this; it's only ever as big as you need it to be and I try to keep this bag very discrete. It doesn't bounce, and despite my being a very small woman, it fits so tightly that I can put a phone or water bottle in the strap and it won't bounce around/
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Spibelt to hold my insulin pump overnight while I sleep. Admittedly, I am near the upper end of the size the belt will fit - a 45” waist. But even with the belt at it’s maximum size, it is considerably too small to be comfortable for sleeping. It needs to have about 4” more adjustment available. I plan to get another buckle and some webbing to make an adjuster to fit between the existing buckle halves.
customer_reviews.author: Engineering Geek

customer_reviews.title: No other phone holder for exercise is comparable
customer_reviews.text: For jogging and hiking. I've tried shorts pocket, an arm band, and this waist belt. The waist belt is by far the best option. There isn't the constantly sway or slapping against the thigh like when the phone is in my pocket and phones are too big nowadays to keep strapped to the upper arm; furthermore, the arm band would always slide down my arm after some time. The waist belt keeps the phone pressed firmly against the back or belly and is very unobtrusive. I hardly notice I have it on.
customer_reviews.author: Rasheed

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding phone when no pockets are available.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother-in-law to carry her cell phone. She's thrilled with it and she plans to use it to hold her phone, cash and I.D. while on vacation, but uses it daily to have her phone handy. It's great because many clothing styles don't have pockets and this belt still allows you to keep your phone handy. My mom has one she uses for her phone as well, so if she falls or has an emergency, she'll have her phone. I plan to get one for myself because I have several outfits without pockets.
customer_reviews.author: luvmoovies

customer_reviews.title: For wearing with insulin pump
customer_reviews.text: I bought his belt because it is very commonly used for T1 diabetics for wearing an insulin pump. It is very comfortable and versatile for wearing during the day. It's small and discreet under clothing. It is very easy to change the length of the belt to wear it different ways. I did not like sleeping with it on. The buckles are uncomfortable and it just didn't work for me, but it's great for wearing any other time. I would recommend this, just not for sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: dreamer7

customer_reviews.title: Stays In Place, No Bouncing
customer_reviews.text: This is the third SPibelt that I have purchased. I bought myself a smaller size a few years ago and then my husband wanted one. Recently I purchased a larger phone and it would no longer fit in the smaller belt so I purchased a large pocket belt so it could accommodate my phone. The only thing I didn't like was having my headphones coming out of the belt up to my ears, so I recently upgraded to wireless headphones and that solved the problem. The Spibelt does not bounce around and stays in place. It also holds up well in the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Flora Jean

customer_reviews.title: I've done several long runs and a half marathon with it and would recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Can't rave enough about this item. It's lightweight, holds my iphone X, and is secure. I've done several long runs and a half marathon with it and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard of Boz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have the original SPIbelt and it fit my smaller phone perfectly, however this larger belt is too small for an iPhone 6 Plus with an Otterbox Defender case. It barely fits and I have to stop my brisk walks to push the phone into the belt, even then, it doesn’t fit all the way, and forget about putting anything else in there, not even Chapstick will fit! This is disappointing considering the measurements, sure thought it would fit, guess I’ll keep searching, or just get a new smaller phone!
customer_reviews.author: A. McNaught

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up for me
customer_reviews.text: This a great product, My first purchase was from QVC but they are not available there anymore. Being that Amazon sells most everything, I decided to check here. I was so glad to know I could purchase it via Amazon. When I wear this belt I don’t need a purse, it’s very concealing to the eye when wearing under clothing. I put my iD, cash and cell phone in it. I am very pleased with this product. Try it, you’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Jay

customer_reviews.title: Just buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: I lose running belts semi-constantly, so I own several different brands from when I rush into Marshalls the night before a race, or tell myself "stop spending twenty bucks on the spibelt, look at all these other brands that are <$10!" and give into the weakness. Don't be me. Just buy the spibelt. It stays put the best, doesn't dig into my hips the best, and is super stretchy; I've at times stuffed a phone, all my ID cards, and even occasionally a small battery pack for long runs and it STILL stayed put nicely. I can't say the same about any of the other brands I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love the SPIBELT
customer_reviews.text: We have about 8 different ones and their primary use is for my husbands insulin pump and this product is just the best! The service has been fantastic too. Only wish there were a few more selections such as ARMY, and not just camo. But overall, I totally or we totally recommend this for everyone. Thank you for a great product that protects the insulin pump and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and bulky
customer_reviews.text: This model looks pretty tight and tidy, but the material wasn't comfortable and it barely fit a phone. I was not impressed at all by this model and while it may work well for hiking, it didn't work well for running at even a moderate pace. Basically a fanny pack, shrunk a little, but not improved much from the 80s.
customer_reviews.author: GLo

customer_reviews.title: Important to know>>>>>
customer_reviews.text: It is not water resistant............my stuff got wet but it is a great belt to use when running. You should not expect to put your phone in it as it is small and my phone bounced the whole time, even after it was tightened. I would say keys, kleenex, etc but overall it serves its purpose. I think these are a bit expensive but if you work out outside it is handy to have
customer_reviews.author: ralfie

customer_reviews.title: My new go to over the Flip Belt
customer_reviews.text: It's just what I needed. Easier to access my phone to change musicnor podcast on a long run. Doesn't bounce. Not completely water/sweat resistant, but most phones are now water resistant, so not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: cups

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: Recieved mine today. If you are looking for a 1" belt with a 1" piece of fabric you need to TRY and stretch over your phone, go for it. Why did I give it 2 stars.. well it is light weight, and with something this small, yes it would be great for traveling. Other than that. No thanks. Way over priced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Katie L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect running belt
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredibly amazing. I carried all of my belongings in an arm band, but this is infinitely easier and out of the way. The belt itself is made of what seems like high quality material. It was able fit my iPhone XR and my keys with no issues. It does not rub in any way while I’m running and I completely forget it’s there. It’s a great product for runners looking for a new way to stash their phones, gels, and keys.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Holes!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve have this product for 5 months. I have only EVER put my iPhone with no case in it. Never keys a credit card or anything else. I run on average 2-3 times a week. The pick now has a large hole, I’m assuming from friction and I can no longer use it. Very disappointed! And it does bounce around And flip when running.
customer_reviews.author: MARISSA BECHTEL

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: It surprises people to see something tiny expand to hold my stuff. I use it to hold a 7" phone with those finger holding pog things on the back, my keys, and cards. It's well built. I got mine in grey, I can use it under or over clothes. I recommend it for those who need a free hand... or times when women's clothing fails us in the pocket department. I haven't tried it's waterproof claim but will update if I do.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D.

customer_reviews.title: The BEST running / workout belt!
customer_reviews.text: Love the SPI Belt! It's not bulky, yet it holds my iPhone, kleenex, keys (and a doggy "bag" when I walk my dogs.) It fits well, snugly against my waist - so it doesn't bounce or feel annoying like other brands I've tried. Highly recommend for runners, walkers, cyclists, hikers... I love mine and use it nearly every day.
customer_reviews.author: HappyVegas

customer_reviews.title: Great Belt pouch
customer_reviews.text: This is a small belt pouch. I can easily hold a small wallet, money clip and some other small item. It also can hold a phone and small wallet (guy wallet !) . It has a zipper that closes the length of elastic pouch. The belt comes from the center, so it doesn't "flop" up and down when you walk/run. Well made item.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P

customer_reviews.title: Still Working
customer_reviews.text: I use the belt for running every day. Just tuck my iPhone into the pouch and take off. Never a problem and don't even know it's on. The clip and zipper pouch is very secure. This is a much better solution than attaching your phone to your arm or wrist, which feels like a blood pressure device, or sticking your phone in your pocket to bounce around. After quite some time and almost daily use, the belt seems to be holding up well too.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for type 1 kiddo!
customer_reviews.text: We use this for my T1 daughter to carry her medical devices which need to be near her at all times. I wish they made kids sizes because it is a little loose but it fits her iPod and PDM (pump) perfectly! It has been awesome for her to carry around her life saving equipment with ease and also play sports comfortably and safely!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Clapp

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this belt now for two weeks and have zero complaints. If you wear it as they suggest (just below your hip bones), it doesn't budge at all. I'm amazed that it holds my Iphone while I run and I forget it's there. So glad I bought it. I'm amazed that the deceptively small pouch holds as much as it does.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Wood

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious. Glad I finally found this!
customer_reviews.text: This is ingenious! Been looking for something like this for such a long time. I use this for work. I need my hands to be free but I also need to have my phones on me at all times. I don't always have pockets for my iPhones. This is the perfect solution I can have my phones strapped to me underneath a loose top, always accessible when I need them. No need to carry a handbag or any kind of shoulder bag.
customer_reviews.author: P A

customer_reviews.title: Great quality running and workout belt, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a true iPhone or other large phone work out belt. The belt and buckle are good quality and the zippered pocket for the phone is excellent. The zipper is of excellent quality and appears to be able to withstand a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lou V

customer_reviews.title: Not your average fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase, super satisfied! Was trying to decide between getting an armband or a waistband. Super glad I went with the SPIbelt! Personally don't like having something strapped to my arm, just felt weird. My concern with a waistband was that the contents would jostle when running/working out, but the belt is secure. Works just as described, and is adjustable. Would definitely recommend, great gift idea, would repurchase!
customer_reviews.author: RinaTay

customer_reviews.title: I bought this based on reviews and I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know what to buy! this, armband or back zip. Based on the reviews, I went with this and it's AWESOME!!! Now I can carry my phone and I don't even know it's there. The arm bands are cool with a running app talking to you, but it's annoying on my arm. READ REVIEWS because this belt is cool!! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: DY

customer_reviews.title: ... holding a (heavy) portable phone charger and it works great! I purchased this for travel mainly
customer_reviews.text: I have tested it out holding a (heavy) portable phone charger and it works great! I purchased this for travel mainly, and I found that it could replace my belt, while holding my pants more securely, then I position it just center of my front pocket and it is virtually unnoticeable even with my slim fit clothing. Also, I adjusted the lengths so the clip is easily accessible, and skip a belt loop or two so everything is accessible. It's a great alternative to packed pockets when traveling coupled with the security of a zipper. I am really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Domenick Petito

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for runner.
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was just a little easier to pull my phone out or slip it back in while I’m on the run, but that’s bc of the very snugness of the spandex (?) that keeps the phone in place at all. But it’s great to move the weight of my phone from my pocket to my waist. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr D

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stays in place
customer_reviews.text: This belt replaced my Flipbelt. Unlike the Flipbelt, this belt stays in place as long as you have it tightened correctly. It is also light weight and breathable. My iPhone 8 fits nicely with room to spare. I like how it expands so your items are held securely, yet easy to access. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E A

customer_reviews.title: Great belt for jogging with!
customer_reviews.text: Prior to getting this belt, I would just have my phone and key in my pocket, which of course bounces around. Using the belt, fits the phone and key just fine, and holds things in place quite nicely. It's snug against the body, but not so tight that it's uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick K.

customer_reviews.title: With daily use the material the pouch is made of, only lasts a year.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this type of Spibelt twice. I like it very much. My only complaint is that the very large lettering covering the elastic belt that surrounds the zip pouch, is huge!!! The appearance would dramatically improve if the lettering were much smaller and in one area near the closure. I often wear it inside out just to have solid black, however the zip pouch is not as accessible. Hopefully the company will take note and increase their sales!
customer_reviews.author: Integrity

customer_reviews.title: Streamlined pouch for phone and key
customer_reviews.text: I found it awkward when it was strapped on my waist and I was trying to put the phone and key into pouch. So, I prepared the pouch before strapping it on my waist and it was a little easier. However, still a bit of challenge to stretch it over the phone w/o dialing the phone by accident or hitting the volume controls. Overall it works better than fanny pack.
customer_reviews.author: Sedulus

customer_reviews.title: My Kids' #1 Choice for Carrying EpiPens, Inhalers and Antihistamines
customer_reviews.text: My kids have peanut allergies. These SPIbelts fit a single EpiPen and an inhaler or two EpiPens, plus a canister vial of antihistamine tablets. They have a low profile. My son wears his backwards, so it's hardly noticeable. My daughter wears hers in front. They look a lot "cooler" than fanny packs, so kids don't tease them. They hold up great. We probably have to replace them about once every 18-24 months, which means they're very durable, given that my kids wear them every day, all day, when they're away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie L

customer_reviews.title: You will love this!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. It’s very minimal. It holds my keys, a credit card or cash and my phone and inhaler with plenty of room and no bulk. It didn’t bounce as I ran. It’s adjustable. I didn’t have it right enough initially and it was sliding down. Once I tightened it up I had no problems. I used this with the spibelt slip on single water bottle (6 oz). It was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jazzygirl

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness belt I've tried so far
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my new Spibelt. I was previously using a fitbelt for running but it was bulky and uncomfortable. The Spibelt is a million times better. It's light, you can barely tell that you're wearing and it fits A LOT. I'm able to fit my iPhone 7, metrocard, house key, and a few bucks. I like that the pouch is stretchy, so it conforms to whatever you're carrying. Another big plus is that the pouch is the only part that fabric, so it doesn't get sweaty and need to be washed constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: love it!  great for running or other general use as a fanny pack
customer_reviews.text: I have worn a spi belt for many years for running and going to festivals and what not, not wanting to carry a purse, but needing my phone, money or driver license. I bought this one because my previous spi belt's zipper broke after many years of use. When running, it does not bounce. It is also adjustable. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: A Fox

customer_reviews.title: Holds epinephrine perfectly for kids.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my nine-year old son so he can hold his epi-pens while he's out playing. We can fit two Auvi-Q pens in here, no problem. The pouch stretches to accommodate the pens, so it works great. So far the pouch has held up well, even to his rough playtimes. I'm happy with the product and glad to know my son has his medicine with him.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: This allows you to never have to hold your phone in your sweaty hand while running very again.
customer_reviews.text: So, this product is great. It's low profilewhich is great fantastic for a runner. I've only had my keys ID and phone (pixel 3) in it and really that's all you need. The phone does stretch the limit of this pouch. The light neoprene like material is holding strong. The belt is pretty standard plastic clasp easy to put on and doesn't dog into you when you run. The only thing I wish it had was a larger pouch to make getting things in and out easier and a better zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Kipker

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: I run on stairs and have a large phone, Been trying to find some way to carry the thing, Too big for pockets. Don't like arm bands. This thin little stretchy pouch works really well. I was skeptical but thought I'd try it. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Curious Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: I had a problem, this thing solved it
customer_reviews.text: Going for walks I was wearing jeans just because when I wore shorts my phone, wallet and keys were banging on my leg. I said to myself, “I wonder if there’s a strap on pocket for walkers” and a google search plus a few clicks later I ordered this. Today I went for my walk and felt the cool breeze on my knees as my phone and keys sat snuggly and comfortably against my belt line. I literally couldn’t feel it as I walked. One caution: I wear size 38 jeans and had to loosen it all the way to fit so if you are bigger than me you may have an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You don't even realize its there
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 215lb 6'1 runner. I wanted something to put my Iphone 7 and a few GU's in. I hate the big gaudy "batman" belts that you see from time to time. This is absolutely perfect. It fits these items perfect and stretches to fit your body perfectly. There's been many times after my run I forgot I had it on and didn't realize until I was changing clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I love that it's light and stays place. However, the zipper bounces off my phone and is noisy. I'm disappointed that it's not a lock zipper. That should be standard on all running accessories and clothes. I actually clipped off the zipper and replaced it with a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: I needed to make adjustments
customer_reviews.text: It works fine after "tweaking." The zipper did not open/close easily so I applied silicone grease to it. That helped the first problem. Also, the zipper tab (the part of the zipper you hold to open/close it would not lay flat (pointed perpendicular to the zipper "tracks". I used a small diameter (round) file to remove some metal interference and that solved that problem. It holds my phone securely while running, and I don't even realize I'm wearing it. I use an app called "RunKeeper" that tracks distance and average time per mile.
customer_reviews.author: Chas S.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for runners
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd SPIbet. I use it for running and it’s the best belt to hold your phone, credit cards or other items. Minimal bouncing (this is my main reason for buying the belt) and not too constructive when it’s nice and snug. Other belts tend to bounce more and are a bit bulkier. I recommend this belt.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Running Belt.
customer_reviews.text: This item is fantastic. Used it for the first time today and I love it. My Samsung Galaxy S10 fit perfect and for my whole run it didnt move at all. I didn't even feel like I was wearing it or that my phone was in it at all. Better than my UA Speed Pocket shorts/pants.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Compact
customer_reviews.text: This is it if you're looking for something that doesn't get in your way when you're working out a sweat, or if you're just traveling and want to hide your valuables. The pouch stretches and wraps around my mom's iphone 6s plus fits, but it's kind of difficult to take out. I'd recommend this for smaller phones or just for keys and money.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Chan

customer_reviews.title: It's a pocket that you wear on your waist!
customer_reviews.text: I love my SPIbelt whenever I go on runs. I just throw my phone and keys into it, zip it up, snap it on, then head out the door. If you have a larger phone or phone case, just be aware that your phone might be a tight fit. The straps are pretty reliable, I rarely have to re-tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: EditableSpline

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought! Great for travel too!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to stick my phone in while working out - it’s been better than I thought. I thought it would bug me or itch or move around a lot. But it is just kind of there - didn’t bother me like I thought. Then bonus! I took it overseas and kept my passport in it during the day - it was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Vermillion

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, lightweight, compact
customer_reviews.text: This is freaking awesome! Worth every dollar. I’m starting to run a little more and I usually have my keys and phone with me. My palms will eventually start sweating with my phone in it and it’s gross. I like this better than the arm straps for phones because I feel more centered than having an extra weight on one side of my arm. Also can be used as a weighted weapon you swing at someone haha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier for phone on runs!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to carry my larger phone (iPhone 7 plus) on runs since I need the music from it. And I also want it for safety. The belt fits snugly around my waist and I actually move it around to my back. I use Bluetooth headphones and my iPhone watch to track my run so have no need to mess with the phone during my run. I really like this product!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Hartzog

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both have one. We run 3-5 miles a day and we love this product. We both carry a phone and it feels like it is not even there. It is easy to adjust, even during the run. My wife and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William Roehrig

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I usually run with a group so i don't bring my phone. But since I am working out alone for the next few months I needed to carry my phone. Phones are bulky and not meant to be held. This solves that issue. I run with this and Bluetooth headphones and it is a dream. The belt does not move at all if fitted correctly and the zipper does not touch the screen of the phone. Cannot say much about the water resistance but it worked well the one time I went running and it started to rain. No moisture on my phone. Awesome for working out. Had to get on for my dad and sister too.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Witkowski

customer_reviews.title: Great Slim Running Belt
customer_reviews.text: This sleek, slim belt fits securely and stays put during my walks (and occasional jogs). It fits my iPhone X (with case and Pop Socket) perfectly, and that's all I need to fit in there - I don't know that much else would fit. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Haley M. Rosendahl

customer_reviews.title: Good for a Few Items
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat thing to toss a couple of items in to but not much. It'll hold my Samsung Galaxy S7, a pair of earbuds and some cash but that's about it. Not ideal if you're looking to carry more than a cell phone in it. Probably could fit a bunch of smaller items. Great for exercising but not so much as an EDC belt.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: love
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SPI belt. My first lasted about three years before it started to get a hole. I would keep my phone, car keys, and sometimes pocket knife in it which probably was asking too much. I like this particular pattern and will continue to purchase from this brand
customer_reviews.author: glenda

customer_reviews.title: Big fan for holding my phone
customer_reviews.text: Haven't invested in a running watch just yet so need to run with my phone to track my run and play music. The thing is pretty ugly so I keep it under my shirt, but it doesn't bounce around and overall i forget it's even there. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for pock r ts
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the small SPIbelt because I wanted something small and light that I could carry my passport in when I travel overseas. I read in another review that this belt's pocket would stretch to hold a passport and IT DOES! I can fit my passport, cell phone (even a Samsung S4), credit cards, keys (and more) inside and still wear it under my shirt. The belt material and buckle appear sturdy as well. I used to wear pants with side pockets all the time just so I could keep my cell phone on me outside gardening. With the SPIbelt, I no longer need pockets.
customer_reviews.author: ordinary shopper

customer_reviews.title: really nice Spi belt
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid cyclist. Spi belt allows me to carry essentials while cycling. Belt is 100% comfortable. Belt tucks neatly inside bib short shoulder straps. Pouch is stretchy and strong. Easily fits nutrition, phone, and wallet. Very happy I found this belt.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Belt!
customer_reviews.text: Best running belt ever. I had a different running belt that I loved and had for years that eventually broke and couldn’t find it to buy again. I ended up getting this one to try out and it is perfect. Better than my other other and it was exactly what I was looking for. It fits my big iPhone perfectly and there is room if you needed to put a key in there too. Just enough room and very snug. It doesn’t slip around at all while I run and I don’t even feel it. It’s amazing.
customer_reviews.author: andrew llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Not for medium to large phones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold my phone during a half marathon. What a mistake. Its too snug of a fit for my Samsung Galaxy S5. The power button is located on the side of the phone and because of the tight squeeze the phone constantly gets unlocked while I am running (so music gets stopped, my running app gets paused, etc.) You get the picture. I recommend this for small phones only.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding items during workout unless you have a larger phone like iPhone+
customer_reviews.text: I really like this personal item belt. Its great to be "hands free" when outside on a walk or a run. If you have one of the larger iPhones, I would recommend getting the large pocket SPI belt. With this belt my iPhone 11+ will barely fit, especially with my earphones connected to the phone. Other than the tight fit of my phone and not being able to get much else in the belt, it accomplishes its goal.
customer_reviews.author: Holly K. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new spibelt after my old one I’ve had for 3 years finally got too worn. Those 3 years included a few half marathon trainings too so it got a ton of use. These last a very long time and are very convenient and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Love me some SpiBelt!
customer_reviews.text: Low profile, adjustable, fits what I need. It’s not waterproof, which is fine – just throw your stuff into a Ziploc before storing it. I’ve use them for years and will keep using them.
customer_reviews.author: SArnold

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and well designed!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first running belt and I love it! Fits my iPhone 8, car key, and small misc items easily. Little to no bouncing, none at all when carrying only phone. I purchased the Sport2People belt as well to compare and it consistently rode up, ending up at my waist every few minutes. Spibelt is much better, rarely ever moving from my hips. Now I won’t leave the house for the trail or gym without it. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying any small personal items!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my daughter who is a runner and she loves it. So I turned around and bought one for myself because I am a farmer. Keeping my cell phone in my pocket is a problem because if I am bending to fix irrigation or climbing through a fence the phone can easily pop out. Also a clip can get caught on something. The spi belt is comfortable, carries my ipone with ease and is sturdy, lightweight, doesn't ride up and comfortable to wear. I would highly recommend this to anyone with with a smartphone. You can even wear it as a bandelero and talk to some one handsfree if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Misha Nogha

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I tried cheaper versions and they were crap. You get what you pay for! SPIbelts are made very well. My first one lasted for many years and it’s still great, I just needed a larger one for my new phone. I won’t ever try the cheaper ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Broken Buckle after a couple uses
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this after running with it the first time. The plastic buckle broke after only a few uses. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: John Herron

customer_reviews.title: a life saver to a diabetic
customer_reviews.text: being a Type 1 diabetic and using Dexcom G5 and Omnipod pump I needed a way to hold my devices and came across SPibelt after trying many other type of devices that failed and were bulky. Spibelt are great and very easy to use and ware under your shirt. They are very comfortable to wear and hold their shape and day in and day out.
customer_reviews.author: rmacbeth

customer_reviews.title: My only regret is not getting one sooner
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it is light and of good quality. My running and fitness activities have become a bit more efficient. My only gripe is the pouch is a bit small. I do not mean to carry a lot in it but a little room would be nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Atit

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & surprisingly spacious!
customer_reviews.text: This holds deceptively more than it looks like it would! When i go for a moderately rigorous run, I don’t feel any bouncing at all. It’s comfortable & adjusts really well
customer_reviews.author: sunita mani

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for walkers and runners
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Much better than a regular fanny pack. There is zero bounce, which is a very good thing. I recommend this product for anyone who walks or jogs and wants to secure keys and phones and gels.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Imboden

customer_reviews.title: The new one looks the same--still a super slim profile---but it has enough room now to comfortably ...
customer_reviews.text: Time to replace my old worn out Spibelt! The new one looks the same--still a super slim profile---but it has enough room now to comfortably hold my smartphone and ID. Other reviews I've read are correct in that it does run much smaller than older ones...it is several inches shorter when put side by side. It is still very comfortable though. I had the old one for close to ten years and, by the end, had to cinch it nearly as much as it would possibly go due to it having stretched out over the years--so perhaps Spibelt is trying to avoid that. Could not run without this :)
customer_reviews.author: Marie L

customer_reviews.title: Great for diabetes and running gear
customer_reviews.text: Great product, makes it easy to run with my Dexcom and glucose gels
customer_reviews.author: Andrew123

customer_reviews.title: Great belt for runners
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday feb 2020 on time. I used to run ( usually 10km) at some point when I finished run, I forgot completely my bag because it is comfortable a lot. Inside was my Samsung S 8, keys, and ID.
customer_reviews.author: manu

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought ths for my college age son to carry his Solu-Cortef emergency injection kit while out hiking with friends. I placed his vial in a prescription pill bottle to protect it from breaking, and attached a medi-alert tag to the zipper pull. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Not for insulin pump
customer_reviews.text: I expected there to be a hole for my insulin pump I was told this one has it but nope so not able to use as I would like to especially with New York heat it would be great to have my pump in this then the clip that can get hot in my skin this would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: JessBeDirect

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Only worn a couple of times, but so far very happy with this purchase. Worn on a run and cutting the grass with no issues. Comfortable but snug fit. Not sure how it’ll hold up with water, but recommend based on price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable way to carry your cell phone while exercising.
customer_reviews.text: I love the comfort of this belt. It is extremely lightweight. It is adjustable to fit closely to your body. No bounce. Perfect accessory fo4 your walk or run.
customer_reviews.author: Bettyann J.

customer_reviews.title: Great belt for running
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this belt by a friend who has one. She let me try hers and it fit my phone and didn’t bounce and held a phone, fuel, a couple keys, and some cough drops. Great belt and would recommend to anyone looking for a simple running belt
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Small, cheap, carries your stuff. What else do you want?
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says on the er, belt. It's lightweight, comfortable, holds my S6 and keys and I forget I'm wearing it. If you are experiencing bounce problems during running check the position of items in the pouch. If you have a phone make sure the phone is centered along the zip. If you jam stuff in there and push it all to the bottom so the pouch is off center with the straps, then it's going to be top/bottom heavy and cause bouncing.
customer_reviews.author: Impossibilium

customer_reviews.title: Love it but not true to (color pink cancer spi belt)
customer_reviews.text: I got the pink ribbon spi belt and the zipper isn’t that pretty light pink that it is shown in the picture, it’s more of a hot pinkish color that’s why I deducted a star and the elastic band is wrinkles a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for jogging in hot, humid weather
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Large pocket Spibelt for jogging. I've used it a couple of times already. I used a Flip belt once for jogging, and it was good, but the Flipbelt was not as comfortable to use in hot, humid weather. I don't know about the Spibelt durability yet, but it looks good. I'm glad I got it
customer_reviews.author: N Vega

customer_reviews.title: No-jiggle belt!
customer_reviews.text: After running a 5k with the car key tied to the drawstring of my running shorts, I decided that I needed a better way to carry my stuff while running. I've tried an arm band for my phone, but it just bounces and slips down and is really annoying. This belt is fantastic! I put my phone in it and took a run . . . no jiggling or bouncing at all. It's small and compact but can expand as it is made from stretchy fabric, and the belt itself is elastic as well. It exceeds my expectation. My only concern - as wife and mom I'm going to be asked to carry everybody else's stuff now! :)
customer_reviews.author: CMBB

customer_reviews.title: This is a great way to carry my phone
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to carry my phone, cash, credit cards, and house/car key with me while out running. I used to carry one of those arm holsters for my phone, but it would always slip down my arm and could only hold a phone and one key. The SPIbelt can hold a surprisingly large amount of stuff and is still pretty comfortable to wear. Get it snug enough and turn it around to the small of your back and you'll almost forget it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Johnson

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my FlipBelt
customer_reviews.text: I had originally purchased a FlipBelt to carry my phone and keys when running, and I ended up only wearing it a few times before finally getting fed up with it. It kept sliding up my waist and was just ridiculously uncomfortable to run with. I purchased my SPIbelt kind of a last resort, and I'm really loving it. It stays at my hips and fits my phone and keys comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna A.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for park time with kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for when my son and I go to the park. I don’t need to hold my phone and keys anymore. It doesn’t bounce when I run with him. Overall great product
customer_reviews.author: Xarhait

customer_reviews.title: Black ones hide under clothes pretty well and can even be worn out when you ...
customer_reviews.text: have many of these for all purposes. Black ones hide under clothes pretty well and can even be worn out when you just don't want to carry a purse! This style and brand is more stretchy but less structured. There are good / bad sides to this. The more structured ones (not this style) look more slender underneath, but are a pain to pull things in/out and don't accomodate iphone + lipstick and keys as well. This version may not "jog" as well because it can be more floppy and less structured - PRO TIP make sure to put the zipper down the MIDDLE not at the top or bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy S

customer_reviews.title: We have thrown it in the wash and dryer and it seems to come out fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my daughter (tween) can carry her inhaler during her runs and athletic practice. So far, it does what I expect it to do. She doesn't carry anything big in it so we don't have the problem of the zipper. We have thrown it in the wash and dryer and it seems to come out fine.
customer_reviews.author: X. Le

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old type 1 diabetic daughter uses it for her phone so she can keep track of her blood sugar while playing basketball. She loves it because it doesn't add bulk and stays in place. Can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the athlete
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what you need it to do. It holds a phone or keys or a wallet so you can work out. It’s nice and stretchy so it can accommodate a few items. However, if you overload it then it is going to bounce and be uncomfortable on a run. If you really need to hold a lot than this is the wrong product. It’s durable. I have one that is several years old and still works great. Simplicity at its best. Built for the job at hand and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: James O.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband who does landscaping and was tired of keeping his phone in his pocket. He absolutely loves it at one point he thought he lost it because he didn’t even realize he had it on!! Great product
customer_reviews.author: slc1977

customer_reviews.title: Wife happy with this item
customer_reviews.text: Wife said. Small discrete comfortable doesn’t bounce when you 🏃‍♀️ or exercise not even with 📱and 🔑. The only issue is that sweat 💦 gets through the belt. Got my wife’s 📱 wet/cover with sweats. Beside that’s she is pretty happy with this item
customer_reviews.author: Abraham R.

customer_reviews.title: Lite and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I needed a case for my Samsung Galaxy S9+. I like to listen to music while working in the lawn/mowing and don't always have pockets or a means to hold my phone. It is a snug fit for the phone, but works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ellyn C.

customer_reviews.title: Practical but not really comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - small form factor - Easy to store, perfect for travel - Flexible and zipper works great - Material is breathable Cons: - Buckle hurts area of contact when it’s snug - not water resistant (not advertised as such but really wish it was) - not really comfortable as it can be because of the buckle
customer_reviews.author: Tang

customer_reviews.title: Enough space, lots of convenience
customer_reviews.text: This is the second SPIbelt I have purchased, sadly, I misplaced the first, after 3 years of faithful service. My husband was heading to a race and wanted to take his phone, key, etc.. I offered my new SPIbelt, he skeptically accepted. After the race, he wanted to order his own! It holds enough, close to your body, so no pulling or giggle. The belt is comfortable and handy.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

product_meta.title: SPIbelt Running Belt, No-Bounce Waist Bag for Runners Athletes Men and Women fits iPhone and Android Phones
product_meta.description:

feature_bullets: Overton Fitness SPIbelt Running Packet: The SPIbelt will expand to hold any smart phone, keys, cash, credit cards, and even a passport. The SPIbelt is ideal for fitness, travel, medical needs, and so much more. The SPIbelt is sleek, secure, and does not bounce.
Can expand to hold any smart phone, keys, cash, credit cards, and even a passport.
Ideal for fitness, travel, medical needs, and so much more.
The SPIbelt is sleek, secure, and does not bounce.
